 There is the potential in a parliament to have a vote of no confidence led to the Prime Minister being outed. That is very difficult, if only, that to be Prime Minister you must be the head of the group/coalition/party with a majority in the lower house (where the PM sits). Thus if you have a lower house of 101, and the PM's party has 65 seats (or members) in that house, he/she is PM. To have a vote of no confidence succeed, you'd have to see the defection of members of your own party... which in turn would very likely see them lose government.
